      • getEventFromName

        protected abstract Class<?> getEventFromName(String name)
                                      throws ClassNotFoundException
        First it tries to return Event in ABBREVIATIONS if such name exists; if not exists, then it will try to find event by event name; if it fails too, will look for full class name. ex) 1. onJoin -> 2. PlayerJoinEvent -> 3. org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerJoinEvent
        Parameters:
        name - name of event to search
        Returns:
        the event class
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - throws if search fails or the result event is a event that cannot receive events.

      • createCustomTrigger

        public boolean createCustomTrigger(String eventName,
                                   String name,
                                   String script)
                            throws ClassNotFoundException,
                                   AbstractTriggerManager.TriggerInitFailedException
        Create a new CustomTrigger.
        Parameters:
        eventName - the class name of the Event that this Custom Trigger will handle.
        name - name of trigger (unique)
        script - the script
        Returns:
        true if created; false if trigger with the 'name' already exists.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - throws if className is not in abbreviation list, not a valid class name, or the specified event is not a valid event to handle.
        ParserException
        LexerException
        IOException
        AbstractTriggerManager.TriggerInitFailedException

      • getTriggerForName

        public AbstractCustomTriggerManager.CustomTrigger getTriggerForName(String name)
        Find and return Custom Trigger with the 'name'
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        null if no such trigger with that name; CustomTrigger if found

      • removeTriggerForName

        public boolean removeTriggerForName(String name)
        Delete the Custom Trigger with 'name'
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        false if no such trigger exists with 'name'; true if deleted

      • deleteInfo

        protected void deleteInfo(AbstractTriggerManager.Trigger trigger)
        Description copied from class: AbstractTriggerManager
        Default behavior is delete one file associated with the trigger. Override this method to change this behavior.
        Overrides:
        deleteInfo in class AbstractTriggerManager
